Theft from a Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $100,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Bianco Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft from a Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.81.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

From Sentencing Hearing January 19, 2016 before Honorable Steven P Anderson, prepared by court reporter Shannon Golat

ADDRESS INFO for Richard J Bianco Jr.
Current: 1 W Lincoln St, Dodge Correctional Institute, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 01-22-2016)
Prior: 514 E. Center Avenue, Ladysmith, WI 54848
DE has indicated does not intend to seek PCR
Case settlement

Defendant Richard J Bianco in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Richard J Bianco in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites case settlement into the court record.  State will amend charge to Class G felony 943.81 and 943.91(4),  PTAC 939.05.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will pay restitution of $107,356.09   J/S with co-defendant Jacquelyn Farrell, Rusk Case 15CF106.  Court finds factual basis exists, DE will enter a plea of NC.  Court will accept and find the DE guilty on amended charge.  PSI waived by DE/Atty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties. 

 Court will order 8 yrs-3 in/5 out, will pay restitution, has credit for 231 days, will be concurrent with 09CF480 Dane County..  Is eligible for CIP, ERP. Atty requests DE be allowed to repay restitution after release from confinement, court will grant.  



  14FA6-DE requests that CS obligations be suspended while incarcerated, CS requests that wage assignment stay in place for a payment of $5.00 per month taken from prison wages.  Ms Richardson has no objection to CS being suspended while incarcerated.   Court will grant suspension of CS while incarcerated, wage assignment will remain in place for amount quoted.
